edu.byu.cs.superasteroids.drawing

Class DrawingHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.byu.cs.superasteroids.drawing.DrawingHelper

  • public class DrawingHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that enables drawing to the game view without having to know anything about Android canvases or matrices.

    • Constructor Summary

      DrawingHelper()

    • Method Detail

      • setCanvas

        public static void setCanvas(android.graphics.Canvas canvas)

      • drawImage

        public static void drawImage(int imageId,
                             float x,
                             float y,
                             float rotationDegrees,
                             float scaleX,
                             float scaleY,
                             int alpha)
        Draws an image to the current game view centered at the specified view coordinates, with the specified rotation in degrees, scale, and alpha. Will not draw if the current canvas is null.
        Parameters:
        imageId - The ID of an image that has already been loaded through the content manager
        x - The x coordinate to draw the center of the image at
        y - The y coordinate to draw the center of the image at
        rotationDegrees - The rotation on the image in degrees
        scaleX - The image X scale
        scaleY - The image Y scale
        alpha - Image alpha (0 - 255, 0 = completely transparent, 255 = completely opaque)

      • drawImage

        public static void drawImage(int imageId,
                             android.graphics.Rect src,
                             android.graphics.Rect dest)
        Draws a portion of an image to a destination rectangle on the current game view. Will not draw if the current canvas is null.
        Parameters:
        imageId - The ID of an image that has already been loaded through the content manager
        src - A rectangle in image coordinates specifying the portion of the image to draw
        dest - A rectangle in view coordinates specifying where to draw the portion of the image

      • drawPoint

        public static void drawPoint(android.graphics.PointF location,
                             float width,
                             int color,
                             int alpha)
        Draws a point to the game view using the provided parameters. Will not draw if the current canvas is null.
        Parameters:
        location - The location of the point in view coordinates
        width - The width of the point
        color - The color of the point
        alpha - The point alpha value (0 - 255, 0 = completely transparent, 255 = completely opaque)

      • drawPointWithPaint

        public static void drawPointWithPaint(android.graphics.PointF location,
                                      android.graphics.Paint p)
        Draws a point to the game view using the provided paint object. Will not draw if the current canvas is null.
        Parameters:
        location - The location of the point in view coordinates
        p - The paint used to draw the point

      • drawFilledCircle

        public static void drawFilledCircle(android.graphics.PointF location,
                                    float radius,
                                    int color,
                                    int alpha)
        Draws a filled circle to the game view. Will not draw if the current canvas is null.
        Parameters:
        location - The location of the circle in view coordinates
        color - The color of the circle
        alpha - The circle's alpha (0 - 255, 0 = completely transparent, 255 = completely opaque)

      • drawFilledRectangle

        public static void drawFilledRectangle(android.graphics.Rect r,
                                       int color,
                                       int alpha)
        Draws a filled rectangle to the game view. Will not draw if the current canvas is null.
        Parameters:
        r - A rectangle in view coordinates
        color - The color of the rectangle
        alpha - The rectangle alpha (0 - 255, 0 = completely transparent, 255 = completely opaque)

      • drawRectangle

        public static void drawRectangle(android.graphics.Rect r,
                                 int color,
                                 int alpha)
        Draws an unfilled rectangle to the game view. Will not draw if the current canvas is null.
        Parameters:
        r - A rectangle in view coordinates
        color - The color of the rectangle outline
        alpha - The rectangle outline alpha (0 - 255, 0 = completely transparent, 255 = completely opaque)

      • drawCenteredText

        public static void drawCenteredText(java.lang.String text,
                                    int size,
                                    int color)
        Draws text in the center of the game view. Will not draw if the current canvas is null.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to be drawn
        size - The font size of the text
        color - The color of the text

      • drawText

        public static void drawText(android.graphics.Point position,
                            java.lang.String text,
                            int color,
                            float size)
        Draws text to the game view. Will not draw if the current canvas is null.
        Parameters:
        position - The position of the text in view coordinates. This point represents the top left corner of the text.
        text - The text to be drawn
        size - The font size of the text
        color - The color of the text

      • getGameViewWidth

        public static int getGameViewWidth()
        Get the width of the game view
        Returns:
        The width of the game view, 0 if the current canvas is null

      • getGameViewHeight

        public static int getGameViewHeight()
        Get the height of the game view
        Returns:
        The height of the game view, 0 if the current canvas is null
